identity_id.description: Machine identity ID. Used to fetch/modify secrets for a given project. This attribute can also be set using the `INFISICAL_MACHINE_IDENTITY_ID` environment variable

token_environment_variable_name.description: The environment variable name for the OIDC JWT token. This attribute can also be set using the `INFISICAL_OIDC_AUTH_TOKEN_KEY_NAME` environment variable. Default is `INFISICAL_AUTH_JWT`.

oidc.description: The configuration values for OIDC Auth

token.description: The authentication token for Machine Identity Token Auth. This attribute can also be set using the `INFISICAL_TOKEN` environment variable

client_id.description: Machine identity client ID. Used to fetch/modify secrets for a given project. This attribute can also be set using the `INFISICAL_UNIVERSAL_AUTH_CLIENT_ID` environment variable

client_secret.description: Machine identity client secret. Used to fetch/modify secrets for a given project. This attribute can also be set using the `INFISICAL_UNIVERSAL_AUTH_CLIENT_SECRET` environment variable

universal.description: The configuration values for Universal Auth

client_id.description: (DEPRECATED, Use the `auth` attribute), Machine identity client ID. Used to fetch/modify secrets for a given project.

client_secret.description: (DEPRECATED, use `auth` attribute), Machine identity client secret. Used to fetch/modify secrets for a given project

host.description: Used to point the client to fetch secrets from your self hosted instance of Infisical. If not host is provided, https://app.infisical.com is the default host. This attribute can also be set using the `INFISICAL_HOST` environment variable

service_token.description: (DEPRECATED, Use machine identity auth), Used to fetch/modify secrets for a given project

block.description: This provider allows you to interact with Infisical

id.description: The ID of the approver

type.description: The type of approver. Either group or user

username.description: The username of the approver. By default, this is the email

enforcement_level.description: The enforcement level of the policy. This can either be hard or soft

environment_slug.description: The environment to apply the access approval policy to

id.description: The ID of the access approval policy

name.description: The name of the access approval policy

project_id.description: The ID of the project to add the access approval policy

secret_path.description: The secret path to apply the access approval policy to

block.description: Create access approval policy for your projects

service_account_email.description: The service account email to connect with GCP. The service account ID (the part of the email before '@') must be suffixed with the first two sections of your organization ID e.g. service-account-df92581a-0fe9@my-project.iam.gserviceaccount.com. For more details, refer to the documentation here https://infisical.com/docs/integrations/app-connections/gcp#configure-service-account-for-infisical

credentials.description: The credentials for the GCP App Connection

credentials_hash.description: The hash of the GCP App Connection credentials

description.description: An optional description for the GCP App Connection.

id.description: The ID of the app connection

method.description: The method used to authenticate with GCP. Possible values are: service-account-impersonation

name.description: The name of the GCP App Connection to create. Must be slug-friendly

block.description: Create and manage GCP App Connection

auth_modes.description: The authentication types of the identity

id.description: The ID of the identity

name.description: The name for the identity

org_id.description: The ID of the organization for the identity

role.description: The role for the identity. Available default role options are 'admin', 'member', and 'no-access'. If you've created custom roles, you can use their slugs as well.

block.description: Create and manage identity in Infisical.

access_token_max_ttl.description: The maximum lifetime for an access token in seconds. This value will be referenced at renewal time. Default: 2592000

access_token_num_uses_limit.description: The maximum number of times that an access token can be used; a value of 0 implies infinite number of uses. Default:0

access_token_trusted_ips.description: A list of IPs or CIDR ranges that access tokens can be used from. You can use 0.0.0.0/0, to allow usage from any network address..

access_token_ttl.description: The lifetime for an access token in seconds. This value will be referenced at renewal time. Default: 2592000

allowed_account_ids.description: List of trusted AWS account IDs that are allowed to authenticate with Infisical.

allowed_principal_arns.description: List of trusted IAM principal ARNs that are allowed to authenticate with Infisical. The values should take one of three forms: `arn:aws:iam::123456789012:user/MyUserName`, `arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/MyRoleName`, or `arn:aws:iam::123456789012:*`. Using a wildcard in this case allows any IAM principal in the account `123456789012` to authenticate with Infisical under the identity

id.description: The ID of the aws auth

identity_id.description: The ID of the identity to attach the configuration onto.

sts_endpoint.description: The endpoint URL for the AWS STS API. This value should be adjusted based on the AWS region you are operating in (e.g. `https://sts.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/`); refer to the list of regional STS endpoints [here](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/sts.html).

block.description: Create and manage identity aws auth in Infisical.

access_token_max_ttl.description: The maximum lifetime for an access token in seconds. This value will be referenced at renewal time. Default: 2592000

access_token_num_uses_limit.description: The maximum number of times that an access token can be used; a value of 0 implies infinite number of uses. Default:0

access_token_trusted_ips.description: A list of IPs or CIDR ranges that access tokens can be used from. You can use 0.0.0.0/0, to allow usage from any network address..

access_token_ttl.description: The lifetime for an access token in seconds. This value will be referenced at renewal time. Default: 2592000

allowed_service_principal_ids.description: List of Azure AD service principal IDs that are allowed to authenticate with Infisical

id.description: The ID of the azure auth

identity_id.description: The ID of the identity to attach the configuration onto.

resource_url.description: The resource URL for the application registered in Azure AD. The value is expected to match the `aud` claim of the access token JWT later used in the login operation against Infisical. See the [resource](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/managed-identities-azure-resources/how-to-use-vm-token#get-a-token-using-http) parameter for how the audience is set when requesting a JWT access token from the Azure Instance Metadata Service (IMDS) endpoint. In most cases, this value should be `https://management.azure.com/` which is the default

tenant_id.description: The [tenant ID](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/fundamentals/how-to-find-tenant) for the Azure AD organization.

block.description: Create and manage identity azure auth in Infisical.

access_token_max_ttl.description: The maximum lifetime for an access token in seconds. This value will be referenced at renewal time. Default: 2592000

access_token_num_uses_limit.description: The maximum number of times that an access token can be used; a value of 0 implies infinite number of uses. Default:0

access_token_trusted_ips.description: A list of IPs or CIDR ranges that access tokens can be used from. You can use 0.0.0.0/0, to allow usage from any network address..

access_token_ttl.description: The lifetime for an access token in seconds. This value will be referenced at renewal time. Default: 2592000

allowed_projects.description: List of trusted GCP projects that the GCE instance must belong to authenticate with Infisical. Note that this validation property will only work for GCE instances

allowed_service_account_emails.description: List of trusted service account emails corresponding to the GCE resource(s) allowed to authenticate with Infisical; this could be something like `test@project.iam.gserviceaccount.com`, `12345-compute@developer.gserviceaccount.com`, etc.

allowed_zones.description: List of trusted zones that the GCE instances must belong to authenticate with Infisical; this should be the fully-qualified zone name in the format `<region>-<zone>`like `us-central1-a`, `us-west1-b`, etc. Note that this validation property will only work for GCE instances.

id.description: The ID of the gcp auth

identity_id.description: The ID of the identity to attach the configuration onto.

type.description: The Type of GCP Auth Method to use: Options are gce, iam. Default:gce

block.description: Create and manage identity gcp auth in Infisical.

access_token_max_ttl.description: The maximum lifetime for an access token in seconds. This value will be referenced at renewal time. Default: 2592000

access_token_num_uses_limit.description: The maximum number of times that an access token can be used; a value of 0 implies infinite number of uses. Default:0

access_token_trusted_ips.description: A list of IPs or CIDR ranges that access tokens can be used from. You can use 0.0.0.0/0, to allow usage from any network address..

access_token_ttl.description: The lifetime for an access token in seconds. This value will be referenced at renewal time. Default: 2592000

allowed_audience.description: An optional audience claim that the service account JWT token must have to authenticate with Infisical.

allowed_namespaces.description: List of trusted namespaces that service accounts must belong to authenticate with Infisical.

allowed_service_account_names.description: List of trusted service account names that are allowed to authenticate with Infisical.

id.description: The ID of the kubernetes auth

identity_id.description: The ID of the identity to attach the configuration onto.

kubernetes_ca_certificate.description: The PEM-encoded CA cert for the Kubernetes API server. This is used by the TLS client for secure communication with the Kubernetes API server.

kubernetes_host.description: The host string, host:port pair, or URL to the base of the Kubernetes API server. This can usually be obtained by running `kubectl cluster-info`.

token_reviewer_jwt.description: A long-lived service account JWT token for Infisical to access the [TokenReview API](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/kubernetes-api/authentication-resources/token-review-v1/) to validate other service account JWT tokens submitted by applications/pods. This is the JWT token obtained from step 1.5.

block.description: Create and manage identity kubernetes auth in Infisical.

access_token_max_ttl.description: The maximum lifetime for an access token in seconds. This value will be referenced at renewal time. Default: 2592000

access_token_num_uses_limit.description: The maximum number of times that an access token can be used; a value of 0 implies infinite number of uses. Default:0

access_token_trusted_ips.description: A list of IPs or CIDR ranges that access tokens can be used from. You can use 0.0.0.0/0, to allow usage from any network address...

access_token_ttl.description: The lifetime for an access token in seconds. This value will be referenced at renewal time. Default: 2592000

bound_audiences.description: The comma-separated list of intended recipients.

bound_claims.description: The attributes that should be present in the JWT for it to be valid. The provided values can be a glob pattern.

bound_issuer.description: The unique identifier of the identity provider issuing the OIDC tokens.

bound_subject.description: The expected principal that is the subject of the JWT.

claim_metadata_mapping.description: Map OIDC token claims to metadata fields. Example: {"role": "token.groups"}, this would become identity.metadata.oidc.claims.role

id.description: The ID of the oidc auth.

identity_id.description: The ID of the identity to attach the configuration onto.

oidc_ca_certificate.description: The PEM-encoded CA cert for establishing secure communication with the Identity Provider endpoints

oidc_discovery_url.description: The URL used to retrieve the OpenID Connect configuration from the identity provider.

access_token_max_ttl.description: The maximum lifetime for an access token in seconds. This value will be referenced at renewal time. Default: 2592000

access_token_num_uses_limit.description: The maximum number of times that an access token can be used; a value of 0 implies infinite number of uses. Default:0

access_token_trusted_ips.description: A list of IPs or CIDR ranges that access tokens can be used from. You can use 0.0.0.0/0, to allow usage from any network address..

access_token_ttl.description: The lifetime for an access token in seconds. This value will be referenced at renewal time. Default: 2592000

client_secret_trusted_ips.description: A list of IPs or CIDR ranges that the Client Secret can be used from together with the Client ID to get back an access token. You can use 0.0.0.0/0, to allow usage from any network address.

created_at.description: The UTC timestamp of the created at.

description.description: The description of the client secret.

identity_id.description: The ID of the identity to create a client secret for

is_revoked.description: A flag indicating token has been revoked

number_of_uses.description: The number of times that the client secret is used

number_of_uses_limit.description: The maximum number of times that the client secret can be used; a value of 0 implies infinite number of uses. Default: 0

access_key_id.description: The AWS access key ID. Used to authenticate with AWS Parameter Store. You must either set secret_access_key and access_key_id, or set assume_role_arn to assume a role.

assume_role_arn.description: The ARN of the role to assume when syncing secrets to AWS Parameter Store. You must either set secret_access_key and access_key_id, or set assume_role_arn to assume a role.

aws_region.description: The AWS region to sync secrets to. (us-east-1, us-east-2, etc)

environment.description: The slug of the environment to sync to AWS Parameter Store (prod, dev, staging, etc).

integration_auth_id.description: The ID of the integration auth, used internally by Infisical.

integration_id.description: The ID of the integration, used internally by Infisical.

aws_tags.description: Tags to attach to the AWS parameter store secrets.

should_disable_delete.description: Whether to disable deletion of existing secrets in AWS Parameter Store.

parameter_store_path.description: The path in AWS Parameter Store to sync secrets to.

project_id.description: The ID of your Infisical project.

secret_access_key.description: The AWS secret access key. Used to authenticate with AWS Parameter Store. You must either set secret_access_key and access_key_id, or set assume_role_arn to assume a role.

secret_path.description: The secret path in Infisical to sync secrets from.

block.description: Create AWS Parameter Store integration & save to Infisical. Only Machine Identity authentication is supported for this data source

access_key_id.description: The AWS access key ID. Used to authenticate with AWS Secrets Manager. You must either set secret_access_key and access_key_id, or set assume_role_arn to assume a role.

assume_role_arn.description: The ARN of the role to assume when syncing secrets to AWS Secrets Manager. You must either set secret_access_key and access_key_id, or set assume_role_arn to assume a role.

aws_region.description: The AWS region to sync secrets to. (us-east-1, us-east-2, etc)

environment.description: The slug of the environment to sync to AWS Secrets Manager (prod, dev, staging, etc).

integration_auth_id.description: The ID of the integration auth, used internally by Infisical.

integration_id.description: The ID of the integration, used internally by Infisical.

mapping_behavior.description: The behavior of the mapping. Can be 'many-to-one' or 'one-to-one'. Many to One: All Infisical secrets will be mapped to a single AWS secret. One to One: Each Infisical secret will be mapped to its own AWS secret.

aws_tags.description: Tags to attach to the AWS Secrets Manager secrets.

metadata_sync_mode.description: The sync mode for AWS tags. The supported options are `secret-metadata` and `custom`. If `secret-metadata` is selected, the metadata of the Infisical secrets are used as tags in AWS (only supported for one-to-one integrations). If `custom` is selected, then the key/value pairs in the `aws_tags` field is used.

secret_prefix.description: The prefix to add to the secret name in AWS Secrets Manager.

project_id.description: The ID of your Infisical project.

secret_access_key.description: The AWS secret access key. Used to authenticate with AWS Secrets Manager. You must either set secret_access_key and access_key_id, or set assume_role_arn to assume a role.

secret_path.description: The secret path in Infisical to sync secrets from.

secrets_manager_path.description: The path in AWS Secrets Manager to sync secrets to. This is required if mapping_behavior is 'many-to-one'.

block.description: Create AWS Secrets Manager integration & save to Infisical. Only Machine Identity authentication is supported for this data source

id.description: The ID of the privilege

identity_id.description: The identity id to create identity specific privilege

is_temporary.description: Flag to indicate the assigned specific privilege is temporary or not. When is_temporary is true fields temporary_mode, temporary_range and temporary_access_start_time is required.

actions.description: Describe what action an entity can take. Enum: create,edit,delete,read

environment.description: The environment slug this permission should allow.

secret_path.description: The secret path this permission should be scoped to

subject.description: Describe what action an entity can take. Enum: role,member,groups,settings,integrations,webhooks,service-tokens,environments,tags,audit-logs,ip-allowlist,workspace,secrets,secret-rollback,secret-approval,secret-rotation,identity,certificate-authorities,certificates,certificate-templates,kms,pki-alerts,pki-collections

permission.description: (DEPRECATED, USE permissions_v2. Refer to the migration guide in https://infisical.com/docs/internals/permissions#migrating-from-permission-v1-to-permission-v2) The permissions assigned to the project identity specific privilege

action.description: Describe what actions an entity can take.

conditions.description: When specified, only matching conditions will be allowed to access given resource. Refer to the documentation in https://infisical.com/docs/internals/permissions#conditions for the complete list of supported properties and operators.

inverted.description: Whether rule forbids. Set this to true if permission forbids.

subject.description: Describe the entity the permission pertains to.

permissions_v2.description: The permissions assigned to the project identity specific privilege. Refer to the documentation here https://infisical.com/docs/internals/permissions for its usage.

project_slug.description: The slug of the project to create identity specific privilege

slug.description: The slug for the new privilege

temporary_access_end_time.description: ISO time for which temporary access will end. Computed based on temporary_range and temporary_access_start_time

temporary_access_start_time.description: ISO time for which temporary access should begin. The current time is used by default.

temporary_mode.description: Type of temporary access given. Types: relative. Default: relative

temporary_range.description: TTL for the temporary time. Eg: 1m, 1h, 1d. Default: 1h

label.description: The label to attach to secrets created in Azure App Configuration

environment.description: The slug of the project environment to sync secrets from.

id.description: The ID of the Azure App Configuration secret sync

name.description: The name of the Azure App Configuration sync to create. Must be slug-friendly.

project_id.description: The ID of the Infisical project to create the sync in.

secret_path.description: The folder path to sync secrets from.

initial_sync_behavior.description: Specify how Infisical should resolve the initial sync to the destination. Supported options: overwrite-destination, import-prioritize-source, import-prioritize-destination

sync_options.description: Parameters to modify how secrets are synced.
